flow.descriptionCdata:
63fd37d3-9759-4776-8901-47e0285f18e0.0409dba7-604c-485d-8c3f-f845d7069c7d.description=This step will execute a SQL Syntax check of all SQL files, reporting pass/fail for each and the number of syntax errors found. INPUTS\: SQL Files - comma-delimited list of fully qualified pathnames for the SQL files to be checked. Ignore Errors - True or False (default of False) flag to enable the step to ignore any errors found and still exit successfully. Database Type - The string used to set the sql parser for the database type. See the sql parser documentation for additional valid options. Default is 'dbvoracle'. OUTPUTS\: Syntax Check Status - True or False. True \= All passed, False \= some failure. Number of Errors - Integer number of syntax errors found. Inputs\: command - executes ExecuteSQLSyntaxCheck.py Call Wrapper - *Required\: The call wrapper to use when executing this step. Default is 'jython'. Database Type - *Optional\: The string used to set the sql parser for the database type. See the sql parser documentation for additional valid options. Default is 'dbvoracle'. Ignore Syntax Errors - *Optional\: Flag to pass the step regarless of syntax errors found. Default is 'False'. SQL Files - *Required\: A comma-delimited list of fully qualified pathnames of all SQL files to be checked. host - Target to run this command against password - Login information for host username - Login information for host protocol - ssh/wmi timeout - Time (ms) before auto-exit\: use ${ExtendedTimeout} to lengthen. Results\: Number Of Errors - Integer number of syntax errors found. Syntax Check Status - True --> All checks passed and False --> Some failure. Exit Code - Exit code of the step needed for branching. 63fd37d3-9759-4776-8901-47e0285f18e0.075c2248-cdd1-4987-97b2-bde8b2c27319.description=cceda572-2b9b-4f44-ae1d-a67d624e1f0f.3d58355e-9a7f-4d61-9e6c-1bfa81120f81.description 63fd37d3-9759-4776-8901-47e0285f18e0.2d5fa491-f196-4f70-806f-cb2fd15a9f67.description= Inputs\: command - executes ValidateOracleSQLRelease.py Acceptable ORA Error - (Optional)\: Comma Separated list of ORA errors that will be expected while running release scripts. (example ORA-00942) Check Database Links Run Flag - (Required)\: "Y" indicates that this check is to be executed. "N" skips the check from being being executed. Check Prohibited Statements Regular Expression - (Optional)\: Exits the workflow if the regular expression entered is found on any of the SQL scripts to be deployed. Check Prohibited Statements Run Flag - (Required)\: "Y" indicates that this check is to be executed. "N" skips the check from being being executed. Check SQL Syntax Database Type - (Optional)\: The string used to set the sql parser for the database type. See the sql parser documentation for additional valid options. Default is 'dbvoracle'. Check SQL Syntax Ignore Errors - (Optional)\: Flag to pass the step regarless of syntax errors found. Default is 'False'. Check System Grants Exception List - (Optional)\: A comma separated list of system privileges that are not allowed in this deployment. Check System Grants Run Flag - (Required)\: "Y" indicates that this check is to be executed. "N" skips the check from being being executed. Execute Rollback - (Required)\: A value of "Y" signifies that an auto rollback is to be performed whenever an error is detected while SQL scripts are executed. More so, the workflow exits and rollbacks all SQL transactions that were committed that belongs to the deployed SQL script. A value of "N" represents that the generated rollback SQL script file is not to be executed. Oracle Home - (Required)\: The path to the Oracle Home directory for the database instance. Oracle OS User - (Required)\: The user who owns ORACLE_HOME. Oracle Password - (Required)\: Oracle database User password. Oracle SID - (Required)\: The SID (Name) of the Oracle database instance. Oracle User - (Required)\: Oracle database User to be used in executing the SQL scripts. Rollback File - (Required)\: The filename and path of the rollback script file that will hold all SQL scripts to be used in performing a rollback. SQL Scripts - (Required)\: SQL script file(s) that needs to be downloaded from software repository that will be deployed onto the target servers. Use comma to separate multiple SQL script files. SQL script file can handle arguments. Example\: MySQLfile1.sql Variable1, MySQLfile2.sql Variable2 Variable3 Staging Directory - (Optional)\: The target servers directory path on where the SQL script file(s) are to be downloaded. host - Target to run this command against password - Login information for host username - Login information for host protocol - ssh/wmi timeout - Time (ms) before auto-exit\: use ${ExtendedTimeout} to lengthen. Results\: Acceptable ORA Error - Comma Separated list of ORA errors that will be expected while running release scripts. (example ORA-00942) Check Database Links Run Flag - "Y" indicates that this check is to be executed. "N" skips the check from being being executed. Check Prohibited Statements Regular Expression - Exits the workflow if the regular expression entered is found on any of the SQL scripts to be deployed. Check Prohibited Statements Run Flag - "Y" indicates that this check is to be executed. "N" skips the check from being being executed. Check SQL Syntax Database Type - The string used to set the sql parser for the database type. See the sql parser documentation for additional valid options. Default is 'dbvoracle'. Check SQL Syntax Ignore Errors - Flag to pass the step regarless of syntax errors found. Default is 'False'. Check System Grants Exception List - A comma separated list of system privileges that are not allowed in this deployment. Check System Grants Run Flag - "Y" indicates that this check is to be executed. "N" skips the check from being being executed. Execute Rollback - A value of "Y" signifies that an auto rollback is to be performed whenever an error is detected while SQL scripts are executed. More so, the workflow exits and rollbacks all SQL transactions that were committed that belongs to the deployed SQL script. A value of "N" represents that the generated rollback SQL script file is not to be executed. Oracle Home - The path to the Oracle Home directory for the database instance. Oracle OS User - The user who owns ORACLE_HOME. Oracle Password - Oracle database User password. Oracle SID - The SID (Name) of the Oracle database instance. Oracle User - Oracle database User to be used in executing the SQL scripts. Rollback File - The filename and path of the rollback script file that will hold all SQL scripts to be used in performing a rollback. SQL Scripts - SQL script file(s) that needs to be downloaded from software repository that will be deployed onto the target servers. Use comma to separate multiple SQL script files. SQL script file can handle arguments. Staging Directory - The target servers directory path on where the SQL script file(s) are to be downloaded. Exit Code - Exit code of the step needed for branching. 63fd37d3-9759-4776-8901-47e0285f18e0.3dd3e366-20fe-4e5e-9aed-7fb56aecd01f.description=Purpose\: Check a SQL script for the use of database links taking care to exclude harcoded strings (text between single ticks). Inputs\: command - executes CheckOracleDatabaseLinks.py File List - (Required)A comma separted list of SQL Scripts to check. Run Flag - (Required)"Y" indicates that this step is to be executed. "N" skips the step from being being executed. Staging Directory - (Optional)The directory containing the SQL Scripts to check. host - Target to run this command against password - Login information for host username - Login information for host protocol - ssh/wmi timeout - Time (ms) before auto-exit\: use ${ExtendedTimeout} to lengthen. Results\: File List - A comma separted list of SQL Scripts to check. Staging Directory - The directory containing the SQL Scripts to check. Exit Code - Exit code of the step needed for branching. 63fd37d3-9759-4776-8901-47e0285f18e0.77b38500-d982-472f-be11-d389d88728b1.description=Purpose\: Apply a regular expression to each sql statement in a script file. Any regex matches are output to stdout and the return code set to 1. Inputs\: command - executes CheckProhibitedStatementsInSQLScripts.py File List - (Required) A comma separted list of SQL Scripts to check. Regular Expression - (Optional) Exits the workflow if the regular expression entered is found on any of the SQL scripts to be deployed. Run Flag - (Required) "Y" indicates that this step is to be executed. "N" skips the step from being being executed. Staging Directory - (Required) The directory containing the SQL Scripts to check. host - Target to run this command against password - Login information for host username - Login information for host protocol - ssh/wmi timeout - Time (ms) before auto-exit\: use ${ExtendedTimeout} to lengthen. Results\: File List - (Required) A comma separted list of SQL Scripts to check. Regular Expression - The regular expression to be applied to the SQL Script. Staging Directory - The directory containing the SQL Scripts to check. Exit Code - Exit code of the step needed for branching. 63fd37d3-9759-4776-8901-47e0285f18e0.7ec13071-095f-4929-8117-02230004df76.description=cceda572-2b9b-4f44-ae1d-a67d624e1f0f.bd326d22-6b83-490a-be69-da623a408d7b.description 63fd37d3-9759-4776-8901-47e0285f18e0.8104dcee-3bff-48b6-b227-a17b763ec4e9.description=cceda572-2b9b-4f44-ae1d-a67d624e1f0f.7a46f752-d2ea-423d-a95b-670082f11cc0.description 63fd37d3-9759-4776-8901-47e0285f18e0.8e85b5ee-00d3-43ae-a527-dd2afed7c7ee.description=Purpose\: Execute a SQL*Plus script with log archieving turned on checking the output for any errors. ** Note - Designed to be run as the oracle software owner (typically oracle). ** If the "Oracle User" variable is not set, the RDC User and password is used. Inputs\: command - executes RunOracleSQLPlusScript.py Acceptable ORA Error - (Optional) Comma Separated list of ORA errors that will be expected while running release scripts. (example ORA-00942 Call Wrapper - (Required) The shell to run this step with which may include changing users with the su or sudo commands. This step should be run with oracle user's permissions. Downloaded Files - No description Execute Rollback - (Required) A value of "Y" signifies that an auto rollback is to be performed whenever an error is detected while SQL scripts are executed. More so, the workflow exits and rollbacks all SQL transactions that were committed that belongs to the deployed SQL script. A value of "N" represents that the generated rollback SQL script file is not to be executed. File List - (Required) A comma separted list of SQL Scripts to check. Oracle Password - (Required) Oracle database User password. Oracle User - (Required) Oracle database User to be used in executing the SQL scripts. Staging Directory - (Required) The directory containing the SQL Scripts to check. Instance.Name - No description Instance.Oracle Home - No description host - Target to run this command against password - Login information for host username - Login information for host protocol - ssh/wmi timeout - Time (ms) before auto-exit\: use ${ExtendedTimeout} to lengthen. Results\: Downloaded Files - No description Execute Rollback - A value of "Y" signifies that an auto rollback is to be performed whenever an error is detected while SQL scripts are executed. More so, the workflow exits and rollbacks all SQL transactions that were committed that belongs to the deployed SQL script. A value of "N" represents that the generated rollback SQL script file is not to be executed. File List - A comma separted list of SQL Scripts to check. Oracle Password - Oracle database User password. Oracle User - Oracle database User to be used in executing the SQL scripts. Status - Execution Status of the SQL scripts. Turn off Supplemental Logging - No description Exit Code - Exit code of the step needed for branching. 63fd37d3-9759-4776-8901-47e0285f18e0.bdc56aa7-0621-4134-a9af-3f9fef31c7c9.description=Purpose\: Check a SQL Script for any system level grants. An exception list can be provided to exclude specific privileges from the check. Inputs\: command - executes CheckOracleSystemGrants.py Exception List - (Optional)A comma separated list of system privileges that are not allowed in this deployment. File List - (Optional)A comma separted list of SQL Scripts to check. Run Flag - (Required)"Y" indicates that this step is to be executed. "N" skips the step from being being executed. Staging Directory - (Optional)The directory containing the SQL Scripts to check. Instance.Name - No description Instance.Oracle Home - No description host - Target to run this command against password - Login information for host username - Login information for host protocol - ssh/wmi timeout - Time (ms) before auto-exit\: use ${ExtendedTimeout} to lengthen. Results\: Exception List - A comma separated list of system privileges that are not allowed in this deployment. File List - A comma separted list of SQL Script files to check. Staging Directory - The directory containing the SQL Script files to check. Exit Code - Exit code of the step needed for branching. 63fd37d3-9759-4776-8901-47e0285f18e0.c2f250c2-7156-4db8-82d6-0f4d2f0a892c.description=Description\: Remove all downloaded files and archives. Dependencies\: Run as file/directory owner. Return Code\: 0 \= All files were removed from the system. 1 \= Errors occurred while removing files. Inputs\: command - executes CleanupDownloadedFiles.py Call Wrapper - *Required\: The jython call wrapper required to run as the owner of the files/directories. Do Not Remove List - *Optional\: List of directories that should not be removed. Download File List - *Optional\: List of file downloaded from the Nerve Center Temporary File Location - *Optional\: The location where all temporary output files will be placed. host - Target to run this command against password - Login information for host username - Login information for host protocol - ssh/wmi timeout - Time (ms) before auto-exit\: use ${ExtendedTimeout} to lengthen. Results\: Exit Code - Exit code of the step needed for branching. 63fd37d3-9759-4776-8901-47e0285f18e0.c58eabc8-f7ff-4cd6-8f3b-92f568741b5c.description=cceda572-2b9b-4f44-ae1d-a67d624e1f0f.5568a2ff-a6f7-4ee1-ab5f-6e88cd8fcf98.description 63fd37d3-9759-4776-8901-47e0285f18e0.description=
 Purpose

To deploy SQL scripts onto a single or multiple target databases.

 Brief Description

This workflow is designed for SQL scripts transactions are deployed and executed against target Oracle databases. SQL scripts are stored and downloaded from Server Automation (SA) software directory. The creation of its deployment provides an option for users to have an automatic rollback executed when an error is generated while running the SQL scripts. This rolls back not only the SQL script that generated the error but also the previously committed transactions defined within the deployed SQL script. Similarly, an option is also provided where users can specify a rollback file that can be executed at a later time. The rollback SQL file can also serve as an audit file for future use which records all SQL transactions performed by the SQL script. (Note. At this time we don't do any pre parsing of the script provided) 


 Dependencies

SA Agents must be installed on all target servers.
The SQL script must reside with in Server Automation's software directory.
Target servers must be in archive log mode.
Oracle instance port must be populated correctly.

 Required Inputs

 Server Target - The desired target to run this flow against.
 Server Target Username - The user to login to the Server Target as.
 Server Target Password - The password to login as the Server Target Username.
 Download Source Host - The target host where the files needed for this flow can be downloaded from.
 Download Source Path - The path to where the files can be found on the Download Source Host.
 Acceptable ORA Error - (Optional)\: Comma Separated list of ORA errors that will be expected while running release scripts. (example ORA-00942
 Check Database Links Run Flag - (Required)\: "Y" indicates that this check is to be executed. "N" skips the check from being being executed.
 Check Prohibited Statements Regular Expression - (Optional)\: Exits the workflow if the regular expression entered is found on any of the SQL scripts to be deployed.
 Check Prohibited Statements Run Flag - (Required)\: "Y" indicates that this check is to be executed. "N" skips the check from being being executed.
 Check SQL Syntax Database Type - (Optional)\: The string used to set the sql parser for the database type. See the sql parser documentation for additional valid options. Default is 'dbvoracle'.
 Check SQL Syntax Ignore Errors - (Optional)\: Flag to pass the step regarless of syntax errors found. Default is 'False'.
 Check System Grants Exception List - (Optional)\: A comma separated list of system privileges that are not allowed in this deployment.
 Check System Grants Run Flag - (Required)\: "Y" indicates that this check is to be executed. "N" skips the check from being being executed.
 Execute Rollback - (Required)\: A value of "Y" signifies that an auto rollback is to be performed whenever an error is detected while SQL scripts are executed. More so, the workflow exits and rollbacks all SQL transactions that were committed that belongs to the deployed SQL script. A value of "N" represents that the generated rollback SQL script file is not to be executed.
 Instance.Name - No description
 Instance.oracle home - No description
 Instance.Oracle Home - No description
 Instance.OS User - No description
 Oracle OS User - (Required)\: The user who owns ORACLE_HOME.
 Oracle Password - (Required)\: Oracle database User password.
 Oracle User - (Required)\: Oracle database User to be used in executing the SQL scripts.
 Rollback File - (Required)\: The filename and path of the rollback script file that will hold all SQL scripts to be used in performing a rollback.
 Server.Become Routine - No description
 SQL Scripts - (Required)\: SQL script file(s) that needs to be downloaded from software repository that will be deployed onto the target servers. Use comma to separate multiple SQL script files. SQL script file can handle arguments. Example\: MySQLfile1.sql Variable1, MySQLfile2.sql Variable2 Variable3
 Staging Directory - (Optional)\: The target servers directory path on where the SQL script file(s) are to be downloaded.

 Optional Inputs

 Clean Code Base - Remove code base from target after execution (True || False).
 Clean JRE - Remove JRE from target after execution (True || False).
 Download From SA - Download binaries from SA (True || False). Must set override for 'SAUser' System Account.
 SA Folder Path - Location of binaries on SA. Must set override for 'SAUser' System Account.
 Debug Level - Set level of output [(least) 1-5 (most)]

 List of supported DML and DDL statements

UPDATE, DELETE, INSERT, CREATE TABLE, DROP TABLE, CREATE VIEW, DROP VIEW, CREATE SYNONYM, DROP SYNONYM, CREATE INDEX, ALTER INDEX, DROP INDEX, GRANT PRIVILEGE, REVOKE PRIVILEGE.

 SQL Output

As of today the output from any reporting sql statements in the script will be printed in XML.



 Additional Documentation

Additional information, including the _HP Database and Middleware Automation Support Matrix_ and solution pack user guides, are available via HP Live Network\:

"http\://hpln.hp.com/group/database-and-middleware-automation"\:http\://hpln.hp.com/group/database-and-middleware-automation

To access the documentation, click the RESOURCES link and enter your HP Passport credentials.

(example ORA-00942 Check Database Links Run Flag - Y" indicates that this check is to be executed. "N" skips the check from being being executed. Check Prohibited Statements Regular Expression - (Optional) Exits the workflow if the regular expression entered is found on any of the SQL scripts to be deployed. Check Prohibited Statements Run Flag - (Required)"Y" indicates that this check is to be executed. "N" skips the check from being being executed. Check SQL Syntax Database Type - *Optional\: The string used to set the sql parser for the database type. See the sql parser documentation for additional valid options. Default is 'dbvoracle'. Check SQL Syntax Ignore Errors - *Optional\: Flag to pass the step regarless of syntax errors found. Default is 'False'. Check System Grants Exception List - A comma separated list of system privileges that are not allowed in this deployment. Check System Grants Run Flag - (Required)"Y" indicates that this check is to be executed. "N" skips the check from being being executed. Execute Rollback - (Required) A value of "Y" signifies that an auto rollback is to be performed whenever an error is detected while SQL scripts are executed. More so, the workflow exits and rollbacks all SQL transactions that were committed that belongs to the deployed SQL script. A value of "N" represents that the generated rollback SQL script file is not to be executed. Instance Wrapper - Jython call wrapper to run as the Oracle Instance owner. No Value - Required\: Used to hide unused parameters in later steps. Oracle Home - Determined from the environment setting for Instance.oracle home. Oracle OS User - The user who owns ORACLE_HOME. Oracle Password - Oracle database User password. Oracle SID - Determined from the environment setting for Instance.Name. Oracle User - Oracle database User to be used in executing the SQL scripts. Rollback File - (Required) The filename and path of the rollback script file that will hold all SQL scripts to be used in performing a rollback. Server Wrapper - Jython call wrapper to run as the admin user. SQL Scripts - SQL script file(s) that needs to be downloaded from software repository that will be deployed onto the target servers. Use comma to separate multiple SQL script files. SQL script file can handle arguments. Example\: MySQLfile1.sql Variable1, MySQLfile2.sql Variable2 Variable3 SQL Scripts to Download - No description Staging Directory - The target servers directory path on where the SQL script file(s) are to be downloaded. Exit Code - Exit code of the step needed for branching. 63fd37d3-9759-4776-8901-47e0285f18e0.f369f894-92c2-4ccf-b357-a4cc07549665.description=This step is designed to facilitate the complicated methodologies that various companies use to distribute their software bundles for installation. Inputs\: command - executes CheckIfDownloadFileExists.py Call Wrapper - Call Wrapper to change the user that runs this step. Download From - List of file(s) to download in non-absolute path format Download To - Absolute directory name in which to place downloaded files Windows Network Share Filepath - No description host - Target to run this command against password - Login information for host username - Login information for host protocol - ssh/wmi timeout - Time (ms) before auto-exit\: use ${ExtendedTimeout} to lengthen. Results\: Download From - List of file(s) to download in non-absolute path format Full Path to Use - Full path where downloaded files will be placed Exit Code - Exit code of the step needed for branching. 63fd37d3-9759-4776-8901-47e0285f18e0.f4469fc4-e1e6-4fbd-a692-b1d0ee999d15.description=Purpose\: Create the rollback script for the last log archieved session. This will create a rollback script which the user may choose to execute in this step itself. ** Note - Designed to be run as the oracle software owner (typically oracle). ** ** Note - This step is designed to work only with "Run Oracle SQL*Plus Script" and cannot be used standalone as it depends on the log archieveing. ** If the "Oracle User" variable is not set, the RDC User and password is used. Inputs\: command - executes CreateandExecuteRollbackScript.py Call Wrapper - No description Execute Rollback - (Required) A value of "Y" signifies that an auto rollback is to be performed whenever an error is detected while SQL scripts are executed. More so, the workflow exits and rollbacks all SQL transactions that were committed that belongs to the deployed SQL script. A value of "N" represents that the generated rollback SQL script file is not to be executed. File List - No description Oracle Password - No description Oracle User - No description Rollback File - (Required) The filename and path of the rollback script file that will hold all SQL scripts to be used in performing a rollback. Status Flag - No description Turn off Supplemental Logging - No description Instance.Name - No description Instance.Oracle Home - No description Instance.OS User - No description host - Target to run this command against password - Login information for host username - Login information for host protocol - ssh/wmi timeout - Time (ms) before auto-exit\: use ${ExtendedTimeout} to lengthen. Results\: Rollback File - The filename and path of the rollback script file that will hold all SQL scripts to be used in performing a rollback. Status Flag - No description Exit Code - Exit code of the step needed for branching.
flow.name: Oracle - SQL Release

staticBinding.value: ${openArgs}Acceptable ORA Error=${acceptableORAError_2};;Call Wrapper=${instanceWrapper};;Downloaded Files=${downloadedFiles};;Execute Rollback=${executeRollback_2};;File List=${sQLScripts};;Oracle Password=${oraclePassword_2};;Oracle User=${oracleUser_2};;Staging Directory=${stagingDirectory_2};;Instance.Name=${instanceTarget};;Instance.Oracle Home=${instance.OracleHome};;Debug Level=${debugLevel};;Server Target=${serverTarget};;Instance Target=${instanceTarget};;Database Target=${databaseTarget}${closeArgs}

${openArgs}Call Wrapper=${serverWrapper};;Database Type=${checkSQLSyntaxDatabaseType_2};;Ignore Syntax Errors=${checkSQLSyntaxIgnoreErrors_2};;SQL Files=${fullPathToUse};;Debug Level=${debugLevel};;Server Target=${serverTarget};;Instance Target=${instanceTarget};;Database Target=${databaseTarget}${closeArgs}

step.name: Check Prohibited Statements In SQL Scripts
step.resultContextKey: Check Prohibited Statements In SQL Scripts

staticBinding.value: ${openArgs}File List=${sQLScripts_2};;Regular Expression=${checkProhibitedStatementsRegularExpression_2};;Run Flag=${checkProhibitedStatementsRunFlag_2};;Staging Directory=${stagingDirectory_2};;Debug Level=${debugLevel};;Server Target=${serverTarget};;Instance Target=${instanceTarget};;Database Target=${databaseTarget}${closeArgs}

${openArgs}Exception List=${checkSystemGrantsExceptionList_2};;File List=${sQLScripts_2};;Run Flag=${checkSystemGrantsRunFlag_2};;Staging Directory=${stagingDirectory_2};;Instance.Name=${instanceTarget};;Instance.Oracle Home=${instance.OracleHome};;Debug Level=${debugLevel};;Server Target=${serverTarget};;Instance Target=${instanceTarget};;Database Target=${databaseTarget}${closeArgs}

${openArgs}Call Wrapper=${instanceWrapper};;Execute Rollback=${executeRollback_3};;File List=${fileList_4};;Oracle Password=${oraclePassword_2};;Oracle User=${oracleUser_2};;Rollback File=${rollbackFile_2};;Status Flag=${status};;Turn off Supplemental Logging=${turnOffSupplementalLogging};;Instance.Name=${instanceTarget};;Instance.Oracle Home=${instance.OracleHome};;Instance.OS User=${instance.OSUser};;Debug Level=${debugLevel};;Server Target=${serverTarget};;Instance Target=${instanceTarget};;Database Target=${databaseTarget}${closeArgs}

step.name: Gather Parameters for Oracle SQL Release
step.resultContextKey: Gather Parameters for Oracle SQL Release

staticBinding.value: ${openArgs}Acceptable ORA Error=${acceptableORAError};;Check Database Links Run Flag=${checkDatabaseLinksRunFlag};;Check Prohibited Statements Regular Expression=${checkProhibitedStatementsRegularExpression};;Check Prohibited Statements Run Flag=${checkProhibitedStatementsRunFlag};;Check SQL Syntax Database Type=${checkSQLSyntaxDatabaseType};;Check SQL Syntax Ignore Errors=${checkSQLSyntaxIgnoreErrors};;Check System Grants Exception List=${checkSystemGrantsExceptionList};;Check System Grants Run Flag=${checkSystemGrantsRunFlag};;Execute Rollback=${executeRollback};;Oracle OS User=${oracleOSUser};;Oracle Password=${oraclePassword};;Oracle User=${oracleUser};;Rollback File=${rollbackFile};;SQL Scripts=${sQLScripts};;Staging Directory=${stagingDirectory};;Server.Become Routine=${server.BecomeRoutine};;Instance.oracle home=${instance.oracleHome};;Debug Level=${debugLevel};;Server Target=${serverTarget};;Instance Target=${instanceTarget};;Database Target=${databaseTarget}${closeArgs}
